news.title: Bhopal civic body to focus on fire safety of commercial buildings now
news.para: It has been six month since the fire in the paediatric ICU unit killed infants in Kamla Nehru hospital. As for the health department, the directive to get a NoC from Bhopal Municipal Corporation (BMC).

news.title: Property-buyers in Bengaluru beware: Fake e-khatas in town
news.para: Following complaints, the sleuths of Anti Corruption Bureau raided many houses last week to track down the culprits. Officials said the raids were conducted following complaints that hundreds of people were duped by issuing fake e-khatas around the City.

news.title: Kolkata: KMRC starts razing Bowbazar buildings
news.para: Cracks surfaced in at least 14 buildings in Durga Pithuri Lane last Wednesday, close to the shaft built for retrieving TBMs that dug East-West Metro’s Esplanade-Sealdah section.

news.title: After inter-department effort, Chandigarh civic body distributes property tax bills
news.para: ​Since residential properties of colonies and commercial properties of villages have been included in the property tax ambit for the first time, the authority has sent the bills to owners of these properties on priority basis to prevent confusion.

news.title: Mumbai: Consumer body starts centre for conciliation
news.para: Bombay HC’s ex-Judge Justice Mridula Bhatkar, who is at present the president of Maharashtra Administrative Tribunal (MAT), inaugurated it on Sunday where MGP chief Shirish Deshpande said more than 5 lakh consumer cases are pending across India before consumer disputes redressal fora and commissions.

news.title: Mumbai: 27 years on, builder to pay family Rs 1.8 crore for Rs 26 lakh flats
news.para: Even as the matter was pending before the National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission, builder Jaswant Bhatia submitted affidavits on February 21, agreeing to pay the amounts in five equal instalments at an interval of every two months to flat buyers Gul Acchra and Kanta Acchra.

news.title: Demand-supply gap, synergies led to acquisition: Gautam Adani on Holcim deal
news.para: Adani, 59, who operates India's largest commercial port and the largest renewable energy company, said he would double Ambuja-ACC's cement capacity to 140 million tonnes over 5 years.

news.title: Haryana CM to meet industry leaders, realtors tomorrow for Global City project
news.para: On the first day of his stay, Khattar will host the conference with industry leaders and real estate companies for the development of Global City.

news.title: Despite Noida authority report on damage, builder yet to kick off repair work: Logix residents
news.para: The residents have been complaining about cracks on the walls and roofs of towers, waterlogging in the basements and poor maintenance of the common area.

news.title: Gurugram: DHBVN blacklists Vipul, no nod to new connections
news.para: DHBVN, an order issued recently, highlighted that as per the decision of the government, the development charges are required to be deposited by builders in one go.  Vipul World, a colony developed by Vipul, has dues of Rs 18.6 crore.

news.title: HDFC, HDFC Life insurance acquires stake in Xanadu Realty
news.para: The investment from HDFC and HDFC Life Insurance Co. is expected to support Xanadu Realty’s proposed strategic expansion initiatives and developing proprietary tech platforms.

news.title: Property sales in China post steepest drop in April since 2006
news.para: Property sales by value in April slumped 46.6% from a year earlier, the biggest drop since August 2006, and sharply widening from the 26.17% fall in March, according to Reuters calculations based on data from the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) released on Monday.

news.title: China asked three builders to issue bonds this week: Sources
news.para: The authorities informed Country Garden, Longfor Group and Midea Real Estate about the plan late last week, the sources said. They declined to be named because they were not authorised to speak to media.

news.title: Pune: Builders yet to submit master plans for two hill station projects to PMRDA
news.para: The state government had approved both the projects, which fall in line with the Aamby Valley and Lavasa projects, in the Pune district under the hill station policy of 1996.

news.title: Whiteland Corporation to invest Rs 3,500 crore for expansion
news.para: “We are gearing up to launch a major integrated residential project of almost Rs 3,500-4000 crore around Diwali this year. We are in talks with global names in the architectural and designing space for creating landmark destinations,” Navdeep Sardana, founder and chairman of the Gurugram-based Whiteland Corporation said.
